text: Mardani Jhumair( also Mardana Jhumar) is a Nagpuri folk dance performed by men in the Indian states of Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh and Odisha. Men wear ghongroo, hold sword, shield and dance in a circle by holding each other's hand. Musical instruments used in this dance are mandar, nagara, dhak and Shehnai or bansi. == References == Category:Folk dances of Jharkhand Category:Folk dances of Odisha Category:Folk dances of Chhattisgarh
title: Mardani Jhumair
